kulami.control

Class ServerMessages

  • java.lang.Object
    • kulami.control.ServerMessages

  • public class ServerMessages
extends java.lang.Object
    ServerMessages establishes a connection to a Kulami server and distributes server messages. It follows the Observable-Observer pattern. Observers must implement the MessageObserver interface and register with the addObserver(MessageObserver) method.
    Author:
    gordon

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ServerMessages(kulami.control.ConnectionData serverConnectionData)
      Create a ServerMessages object that can be used to connect to a Kulami server and distribute server messages.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addObserver(kulami.control.MessageObserver observer)
      Register a MessageObserver that wants to be sent Kulami server messages.
      void connectAndListen()
      Establish connection with the server given in the constructor and start a new thread that runs an infinite loop that listens for Kulami server messages and distributes them to all registered MessageObservers.
      void disconnect()
      Stop the thread listening to a Kulami server.
      void removeObserver(kulami.control.MessageObserver observer)
      Remove a MessageObserver from the list of observers.
      void sendTestMessage() 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ServerMessages

        public ServerMessages(kulami.control.ConnectionData serverConnectionData)
        Create a ServerMessages object that can be used to connect to a Kulami server and distribute server messages. The argument ConnectionData must contain the address of a running Kulami server.
        Parameters:
        serverConnectionData -

    • Method Detail

      • connectAndListen

        public void connectAndListen()
        Establish connection with the server given in the constructor and start a new thread that runs an infinite loop that listens for Kulami server messages and distributes them to all registered MessageObservers.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Stop the thread listening to a Kulami server.
